page.title: 12CLUBS IN WARTON
page.content: The Warton Institute provides a focal point of village life. It caters for all age groups. The Senior Citizens form an active group which meets weekly. Outings are organised regularly. Various day and evening classes are held there. They include keep fit, dancing, needlework, etc. The Womens' Institute meets fortnightly. The youth club meets twice weekly. The Warton drama group rehearses weekly and stages its productions there. A pre-school playgroup is held on 4 mornings a week and a mother and toddler group meets weekly. Childrens' groups are particularly active and include cubs, scouts, brownies and guides. A Sunday school is held at St Paul's church. Bridges Playing Field is the venue for the local Cricket Club. A tennis club used to meet here, but has ceased.
